revised_title: Measurements of the Absolute Indices of Refraction in Strained Glass
tldr: The authors describe a method to measure the absolute indices of refraction in strained glass by observing the deviation of light passing through a slab of glass under flexure. They also discuss the stress-optical coefficients for vertically and horizontally polarized rays and present the results of their experiments on two different types of glass. The authors propose a new unit, the "brewster," to express stress-optical coefficients.
